intro: Peucedanum filicaule, commonly known as the broad-leaved hogweed, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, compound leaves that are often divided into broad, lance-shaped segments. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its roots are fibrous and can be somewhat aromatic. Peucedanum filicaule is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
